userreviews.userReview: Got this as a free eBook on my mom's Nook, a short collection of 3 stories about dogs. The first two stories skew towards a young demographic, i.e. early elementary school age. #1 is about two dogs caught by the dogcatcher who learn from an older dog at the shelter how to make themselves presentable to humans in hopes of being adopted. #2 involves a dog who is reminded by his friends at the dog park (including a dog named Bruno, whose breed isn't identified like the others were) that his 1st birthday is coming up and to make a wish. #3 concerns a basset hound whose owner has passed away and only one of the lady's 3 children can possibly adopt the dog, but his wife is skeptical until a life-changing event occurs.That 3rd story doesn't seem to fit with the others because although all had happy endings, that one is about a more adult situation and deals with things that might be scary to kids, including death and snakes.Overall, a simple eBook and easy to see why it was free. The last page indicates the author is working on a full-length book, but unless the stories are written more maturely, I think I'll leave that book to the kids.

This book was a freebie so no complaints about the price. The stories were cute but it was way too short and for the most part basic writing. I imagine it was intended for the very young (at least they can sit through it in one sitting) but even so if I had to pay for it, I would really be unhappy with it.

This is a cute collection of three very short stories about dogs and their humans. The third story is a touching story about a man in a state of grief connecting with his mom's dog. The first two stories focus more on the points of view of the dogs. This is a book that could use more development, and a bit stronger vocabulary, but it will still have any dog lover smile.

This was a nice easy read. I love animals and to read stories about any kind just brings tears to my eyes.There are 3 stories in this book. Stray dogs that become best friends, a dog's birthday wish, and just a dog that joins a new family.I enjoyed the book and just seeing life through the eyes of dogs.

This was a freebie so it's hard to be disappointed in it. The book has three short stories - all of them are cute. Sadly, it was a little too short, but I can see this being a great book for younger kids.

1.5 stars. Listen, I love dogs and I still thought this was a rather lazy attempt on the author's part. The third story (of three) was the strongest (I use that term relatively) and slightly helps redeem the first two. Pretty predictable stuff here.
Really cute
A bunch of cute little dog tales to make you smile on a bad day.
Even tho it was only 3 short stories, it was a nice read something you can read to kids.
thought i was getting a bunch of short stories. there were only three very, very, very short stories. they were cute though. i will probably re-read them to my grandson.
i read this book in 4th grade and i read it like 4 times and loved it llike crazyyyyyyyyyyyyyy!!
Ok, sappy, but dog lovers may like.
A collection of shorts stories about man's best friend. It's a nice quick read to accompany a hot cup of coffee.
Incredibly short stories (3).
I just didn't get into these - they felt very juvenile and boring.
Somewhat cute, but too short and overly simplistically written with quite a few spelling errors/typos. Rather glad that this was a freebie for the Nook. Nice idea, but the stories needed more depth.
Another free ebook from my nook. Breath of fresh air after reading all my suspense novels. Cute book from the dog's perspective. Very short read.
very very short (like28 pages). Being this was a freebie I wasn't too disappointed. The content was nice, but just too short of a story.
This was a cute quick read.
Well, aside from the bad grammer and extremely short narratives, it was sweet. Took me about 8 minutes to read. Glad it was free!!
Cute stories but way too short. Would have loved to read many more of these short stories from the "dog's point of view". Write ore, Alive V.
This was a short book with only 3 short stories. It was a cute book but probably more appropriate for teen readers.
This was a very short, simple book containing a few short stories, most from a dogs point of view. It was interesting, but nothing spectacular. Dog lovers will enjoy it.
This was 3 short stories. I read them to my 6 yr. old neighbor girl and she enjoyed them. I enjoy almost anything about dogs, since I'm a dog lover.
Cute and interesting short stories that will touch everyones heart. A must read for all ages.
this was a cute little kid book, if i was a little kid, i would of read it. are asked my momma to read it :]. 3 and up
Absolutely loved these 3 short stories. I started off reading this to my grandson who quickly lost interest but I just kept reading (out loud). A must read for animal lovers.
3 short stories - could have been told better
This is a cute book about dogs, there are three short stories which the children liked! I liked the third story the best! If you like dogs then I recommend getting this free e-book!
This was a freebie for my nookbook. It was very very short. Not a reread

description: A collection of short stories for the dog lover. Love, strength, and companionship is all that any dog could ever want but when destiny seems to have other things in mind, these furry friends somehow defy the odds and warm the hearts of those who give them a "forever home."
title: Puppy Dog Tales
